p: We used ANCOVAs (i.e., ANOCOVAs) to examine the effects of soil type (categorical variable: rhizosphere of A. sessilis vs. rhizosphere of A. philoxeroides), latitude (continuous variable), and their interaction on soil chemistry variables. We used Cohen’s f 2 to estimate local effect sizes. We considered effects to be significant when the P-values were <0.05 and classified the effect magnitudes as small (0.10 < f 2 ≤ 0.25), medium (0.25 < f 2 ≤ 0.40), or large (0.40 < f 2) following previously published guidelines [ 45]. We used principal component analysis (three axes) to examine variation in environmental variables (i.e., climate and soil properties).
